info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 5:26AM CDT until August 12 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CDT FOR MONROE...ST. CLAIR...JEFFERSON AND SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 526 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mascoutah to near New Athens to near New Design to 6 miles southwest of Hillsboro, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Belleville, O`Fallon, Swansea, Shiloh, Festus, Waterloo, Mascoutah, De Soto, Pevely, Crystal City, Lebanon, Freeburg, Red Bud, Herculaneum, New Baden, Hillsboro, Scott AFB, Smithton, New Athens, and Marissa. This also includes Sandy Creek Covered Bridge Historic Site and Gov. Dunklin`s Grave Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 19 and 27. Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 170 and 180. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
